Key Match Events: Joachim Andersen went from hero to zero when his close-range finish was disallowed for offside before he conceded a penalty converted by Havertz in the 53rd minute.
Jamal Musiala scored in the 68th minute to equal Georgia's Georges Mikautadze as Euro 2024 top-scorer with three goals.
Kai Havertz scored the first penalty of the match in the 53rd minute.
Denmark almost scored in the 35th minute when Andersen fired in a loose ball inside the box after a free kick, but the effort was ruled out by the VAR.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was suspended for 20 minutes in the first half due to thunderstorm.
Germany started strongly in front of an expectant crowd, while Denmark struggled to create any type of combinations, barely crossing the halfway line in the first 15 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany defender and player of the match Antonio Rüdiger stated that everyone who watched the match will be of the opinion that Germany was dominant from the start. He criticized the team for missing too many chances.
It feels really good, said Rüdiger, emphasizing Germany's dominance from the start and the missed opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was stopped for over 20 minutes when referee Michel Oliver ordered the players to return to the pitch for a brief warm-up before it restarted.
Germany almost scored when Havertz's header was brilliantly saved by Schmeichel.
